009
010package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * This class represents a pure 2D rotation about the coordinate origin (as a
017 * special case of affine mapping). It can be assumed that every instance of
018 * this class is indeed a rotation. See Secs. 21.1.3 and 21.3.1 of [1] for
019 * details.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
023 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 * 
026 *  @author WB
027 */
028public class Rotation2D extends AffineMapping2D {
029        
030        /**
031         * Constructor. Creates a 2D rotation by a given
032         * angle about the origin.
033         * @param alpha rotation angle (in radians)
034         */
035        public Rotation2D(double alpha) {
036                super(
037                         Math.cos(alpha), -Math.sin(alpha), 0,
038                         Math.sin(alpha),  Math.cos(alpha), 0);
039        }
040        
041        /**
042         * Auxiliary constructor used internally for duplicating instances.
043         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
044         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
045         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
046         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
047         */
048        protected Rotation2D(double a00, double a01, double a10, double a11) {
049                super(a00, a01, 0, a10, a11, 0);
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Constructor. 
054         * Creates a new {@link Rotation2D} object from an existing instance.
055         * @param m a {@link Rotation2D} instance
056         */
057        public Rotation2D(Rotation2D m) {
058                this(m.a00, m.a01, m.a10, m.a11);
059        }
060        
061        // ----------------------------------------------------------
062        
063        /**
064         * Concatenates this rotation (A) with another rotation (B) and returns
065         * a new rotation (C), such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
066         * @param B the second rotation
067         * @return the concatenated rotations
068         */
069        public Rotation2D concat(Rotation2D B) {
070                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
071                return new Rotation2D(C[0][0], C[0][1], C[1][0], C[1][1]);
072        }
073        
074        @Override
075        public Rotation2D duplicate() {
076                return new Rotation2D(this);
077        }
078        
079        @Override
080        public Rotation2D getInverse() {
081                return new Rotation2D(a00, -a01, -a10, a11);
082        }
083
084}
085
086
087
